definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: We foresee a soft landing, but this cannot be taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 我們預期會出現軟着陸，但不能將其視爲理所當然。

sentences.english: At the biggest companies, long-term investment is taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 在大公司，長期投資被視爲是理所當然的。

sentences.english: Fittingly, there should be a deep focus on trade and investment.
sentences.chinese: 理所當然，峯會應當重點關注貿易和投資。

sentences.english: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.
sentences.chinese: 你們作兒女的，要在主裏聽從父母，這是理所當然的。

sentences.english: The well- disciplined soldiers carried out their orders without question.
sentences.chinese: 訓練有素的士兵理所當然地執行了命令。

sentences.english: I was surprised; I looked down, flushing, of course.
sentences.chinese: 我很驚訝，只得低下了頭，理所當然地臉紅了。

sentences.english: It is taken for granted by the public-at-large.
sentences.chinese: 公衆把新聞界的影響力看成是理所當然的。

sentences.english: Dot take for granted the things closest to your heart.
sentences.chinese: 別把最貼心的事情當成理所當然。

sentences.english: With, thus far, we've taken that for granted.
sentences.chinese: 至此，我們把那個當成時理所當然的了。

sentences.english: Don't take for granted what you have.
sentences.chinese: 不要認爲你所擁有的是理所當然的。

sentences.english: She had good reason to feel angry.
sentences.chinese: 理所當然，厄里斯爲此感到憤怒。

sentences.english: Many effective prescription will become a matter of course the recipe.
sentences.chinese: 許多有效的方劑也就理所當然的成爲祕方。

sentences.english: And, as a result, this book would have been mainly about Shanti Uncle.
sentences.chinese: 理所當然的，這本書本應主要記述山狄叔叔。

sentences.english: But I certainly like what he's done for this town.
sentences.chinese: 但是我理所當然地喜歡他爲這個城市所做的一切。

sentences.english: While talking the Ya in the eye however became naturally.
sentences.chinese: 說話時，眼裏的訝然就變成了理所當然。

definition: conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
